tool_description: Performs initial inspection and functional testing of the digital multimeter before calibration to identify obvious defects, verify basic operation, and document initial condition.

dut_model.description: Model number of the digital multimeter being calibrated

serial_number.description: Serial number of the device under test

visual_inspection.description: Whether to perform visual inspection of the device

function_test.description: Whether to perform basic function tests

range_switching_test.description: Whether to test range switching operation

preliminary_accuracy.description: Whether to perform preliminary accuracy check

warm_up_time.description: Device warm-up time in minutes before testing

ambient_temp.description: Ambient temperature during inspection in Celsius

error_messages: Physical damage detected: Device shows signs of physical damage that may affect calibration accuracy.
Display malfunction: LCD display is not functioning properly. Repair required before calibration.
Battery voltage low: Battery voltage insufficient for reliable operation during calibration.
Range switching failure: Device fails to switch between measurement ranges properly.
Warm-up time insufficient: Device has not stabilized. Extend warm-up period before proceeding.
Environmental conditions invalid: Ambient temperature or humidity outside acceptable limits for inspection.
Function test failed: Basic functionality test failed. Device requires repair before calibration.
Invalid model or serial: Model number or serial number format is incorrect.
usage: Provide device model, serial number, and environmental conditions. Enable desired inspection tests. Tool performs comprehensive pre-calibration assessment and documents findings.

defects_found.description: List of defects or issues identified during inspection

ready_for_calibration.description: Whether device is ready to proceed with calibration

inspection_notes.description: Additional notes from the inspection process
